job_description: Kardium is a dynamic company made up of a group of highly talented individuals with expertise in business, management, electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, and software development.  We are focused on developing innovative, highly differentiated medical devices.  Kardium has assembled a highly skilled product development team and a fully-equipped rapid prototyping workshop and laboratory in order to commercialize several innovative medical devices, including unique percutaneous approaches to treating atrial fibrillation and mitral valve regurgitation.Kardium is developing a novel catheter-based system for treatment of atrial fibrillation.  The system includes an electrical control system involving a large number of sensors and an energy delivery system to form lesions within the patientâ€™s heart. The system must be designed and verified to medical device standards. Kardium is seeking a co-op student who wishes to gain hands-on experience in the engineering and development of complex and leading-edge medical devices. The successful candidate will perform various activities related to the electrical control system, such as:    * Planning and execution of design verification tasks (e.g. writing test protocols and performing testing)    * Execution of design changes (e.g. analysis of new concepts and creating or modifying engineering drawings)    * Execution of manufacturing process related improvements (e.g. jig and fixture design)
job_requirements: The successful candidate will:    * Have experience with electrical design and hands-on electrical ability    * Have experience with electrical test equipment    * Be highly proactive and able to execute tasks with minimal instruction and guidance    * Be enthusiastic about finding innovative solutions to unforeseen challenges    * Have a history of success working in a team settinThe following factors are greatly desired and will greatly increase the suitability of the candidate:    * A strong grasp of mathematics and analysis tools    * Excellent knowledge of eCAD, particularly Altium    * Experience with VHDL    * Excellent technical writing skillsOpen To All Majors:No
